## Getting Started
Follow this guide to set up and start with ChirpNest

[![](https://mermaid.-)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#-)

### Prerequisites
* LORIX One with power over ethernet cable (See https://www.lorixone.io/)
  * Power supply
* SD card (minimum 8 GB, 10 MB/s writing speed or more recommended)
* ChirpNest image file for LORIX One (See **TODO**)
* KELLER's [ADT1-Tube](https://keller-druck.com/en/products/data-loggers/remote-transmission-units-with-data-logger/adt1-tube) or [ADT1-Box](https://keller-druck.com/en/products/data-loggers/remote-transmission-units-with-data-logger/adt1-box) LoRaWAN device with sensor/s attached
* Computer with
  * SD card reader
  * Browser
  * SSH client
* Flashing software (e.g. balenaEtcher from balena.io/etcher)
* Local network that allows communication between the computer and the LORIX One

### A. Get prepared ChirpNest image
[TODO]

### B. Prepare the LORIX One device
Insert the SD card into the computer and flash the ChirpNest image onto it using the third-party flashing software.
Connect the LORIX One to the local network, put the SD card into the LORIX One and power it.

### C. Initial setup LORIX One with the ChirpStack web interface
Discover the IP address of the LORIX One e.g. through a web interface on the router.
Connect to the LORIX One using an SSH client.
Username: âadminâ
Password: âadminâ
In Windows 10, PowerShell can be used with the following command (replace âIP_Addressâ with the actual IP address of the LORIX One):
```sh
ssh admin@IP_Address
```
When connected to the LORIX One, type the following command:
```sh
sudo gateway-config
```
Enter the password âadminâ again when prompted.

Select âConfigure channel-planâ using the arrow buttons and enter.
Select âEU868 4dBi (outdoor)â.
Confirm the following four messages with enter.
Select âQuitâ.
Check if date and time are correct with the following command:
```sh
$	date
```
If date and time are not correct, set it with the following command (enter the current UTC time):
```sh
$	sudo date -s '2020-06-09 07:10:00'
```
Terminate the SSH connection by entering the following command:
```sh
exit
```

### D. Configure ChirpNest with the ChirpStack Web Interface
Connect to the LORIX One ChirpStack web interface with a browser on port 8080 (i.e. call http://IP_Address:8080 and replace âIP_Addressâ with the actual IP address of the LORIX One).
Log in using the following credentials:
Username: âadminâ
Password: âadminâ

Navigate to âNetwork-serversâ, click the â+ Addâ button, enter the following data and click âAdd network-serverâ:

* General
  * Network-server name: âChirpNest-Network-Serverâ
  * Network-server server: âlocalhost:8000â
* Gateway discovery
  * leave all fields unchanged
* TLS certificates
  * leave all fields unchanged

Navigate to âService-profilesâ, click the â+ Createâ button, enter the following data and click âCreate service-profileâ:
* Service-profile name: âChirpNest-Service-Profileâ
* Network-server: select âChirpNest-Network-Serverâ
* remaining fields: leave unchanged

Navigate to âDevice-profilesâ, click the â+ Createâ button, enter the following data and click âCreate device-profileâ (the following parameters are chosen specifically for and tested with the ADT1; using OTAA instead of ABP should also be possible):
* General
  * Device-profile name: âdevice_profile_1.0.2_B_abp_ADT1â
  * Network-server: select âChirpNest-Network-Serverâ
  * LoRaWAN MAC version: select â1.0.2â
  * LoRaWAN Regional Parameters revision: select âBâ
  * remaining fields: leave unchanged
* Join (OTAA / ABP)
  * leave all fields unchanged
* Class-B
  * leave all fields unchanged
* Class-C
  * leave all fields unchanged
* Codec
  * Payload codec: select âCustom JavaScript codec functionsâ
  * Decode function:
paste the decode function, see âDecode function for ADT1â on page 119
make sure the function signature is function Decoder(port, bytes)
* Encode function:
leave unchanged

Navigate to âApplicationsâ, click the â+ Createâ button, enter the following data and click âCreate applicationâ:
* Application name: âChirpNest-Applicationâ
* Application description:
âThis is the single application configured on this ChirpNest environment.â
* Service-profile: select âChirpNest-Service-Profileâ

Navigate to âApplicationsâ, select the single existing application âChirpNest-Applicationâ (click on the name) which navigates to the âDevicesâ tab of that application, then click the â+ Createâ button, enter the following data and click âCreate deviceâ:

* General
  * Device name: enter any name consisting of letters, numbers and hyphens (e.g. âADT1Â­NoÂ­92â where 92 is the serial number)
  * Device description: enter any description (e.g. âADT1 with serial number 92â)
  * Device EUI: enter the device EUI of your device (e.g. â00 9D 6B 00 00 C5 D2 4Fâ)
  * Device-profile: select âdevice_profile_1.0.2_B_abp_ADT1â
  * Disable frame-counter validation: check
* Variables
  * leave unchanged
  *	Tags
* leave unchanged

Navigate to âApplicationsâ, select the single existing application âChirpNest-Applicationâ (click on the name) which navigates to the âDevicesâ tab of that application, select the single existing device just created before (click on the name), switch to the âActivationâ tab, enter the following data and click â(Re)activate deviceâ:
* Device address:
enter the device address of your device (e.g. â26 01 16 83â) or click the round arrow to generate a new device address which must then be configured on the ADT1
* Network session key (LoRaWAN 1.0):
enter the network session key of your device (e.g. âE6 19 A5 8F 1F 1F 84 F2 C3 0B 2E EA 1E 1F B4 7Dâ) or click the round arrow to generate a new network session key which must then be configured on the ADT1
* Application session key (LoRaWAN 1.0):
enter the application session key of your device (e.g. âF5 32 68 0E C0 4C C4 95 7D AA FC 5E 34 CC 6E 35â) or click the round arrow to generate a new application session key which must then be configured on the ADT1
* Uplink frame-counter: leave â0â
* Downlink frame-counter: leave â0â

Now the ADT1 is configured and activated. You can verify by opening the âDevice dataâ tab on your newly created device configuration and then sending a measurement packet (see âConfigure ADT1 Deviceâ below). Note that the âDevice dataâ tab must be opened before the measurement is sent.

Last step: Send the information packet from the ADT1 device so the details of the device are stored in ChirpNest (see âConfigure ADT1 Deviceâ below). After that, the configuration of ChirpNest is complete.


### E. Connect KIWI Desktop with ChirpNest
When ChirpNest is set up, KIWI Desktop can simply be connected to ChirpNest by entering the IP address of the LORIX One.

### F. Configure ADT1 Device
This section explains how the required parameters âdevice EUIâ, âdevice addressâ, ânetwork session keyâ and âapplication session keyâ can be read out and/or configured.
The software âGSM setup for remote transmission unitsâ needs to be installed on the Windows computer. It can be downloaded from here:
https://keller-druck.com/en/products/software/desktop-applications/gsm-setup-for-remote-transmission-units
Connect the ADT1 device to the Windows computer using a Micro USB cable.
Select the corresponding COM port and press the âRead Configurationâ button (see screenshot).

![press the âRead Configurationâ button](https://github.com/ChirpNest/ChirpNest/blob/master/documentation/gsm-setup-01.jpg "press the âRead Configurationâ button")

To read out or configure said parameters, switch to the âLoRa Settingsâ tab. The parameters are then displayed (see screenshot). To configure the parameters, select âABPâ as âActivation Methodeâ and enter the parameters. Press the âWrite Configurationâ button after entering the parameters.

![Press the âWrite Configurationâ button](https://github.com/ChirpNest/ChirpNest/blob/master/documentation/gsm-setup-02.jpg "Press the âWrite Configurationâ button")

To send the information packet from the ADT1 device, switch to the âError/Statusâ tab and press the âSend Info LoRaâ button (see screenshot).

![press the âSend Info LoRaâ button](https://github.com/ChirpNest/ChirpNest/blob/master/documentation/gsm-setup-03.jpg "press the âSend Info LoRaâ button")

To manually trigger sending a measurement packet, the button âSend Measure-Data LoRaâ can be pressed.


### G. Build your own ChirpNest image
#### G1. Create ChirpNest image
Navigate to the folder where the repository should be created and clone it:

```sh
$	git clone https://github.com/ChirpNest/ChirpNest
```
Run the following commands:
```sh
$	make submodules
$	make permissions
$	sudo docker-compose run --rm busybox
```
(indented commands are to be run within the docker machine)
```sh
    $	chown 999:999 /build
    $	exit
$ sudo docker-compose run --rm yocto bash
    $	source oe-init-build-env /build/ /chirpstack-gateway-os/bitbake/
``` 
   The configurations should already be correct. However, if a configuration needs to be edited, now is the moment to do that. 
```sh
    $	nano conf/local.conf
    $	nano conf/bblayers.conf
```
   Run the following command to start creating the image:
```sh
    $	bitbake chirpstack-gateway-os-full
```
   Continue:
```sh
    $	/chirpstack-gateway-os/scripts/chirpstack-prepare-deploy
    $	exit
```
Now, the file ending with .sdimg.gz is the image file. Itâs located here:
```sh
$	ls -l ./deploy/wifx/lorix-one-512-sd/3.2.0test1/
```

#### G2A. Use prepared 'KIWI Server' module
[TODO]
#### G2B. Build 'KIWI Server' module
[TODO]

### How to decode 
The decode function is provided by KELLER in a [GitHub repository](https://github.com/KELLERAGfuerDruckmesstechnik/KellerAgTheThingsNetworkPayloadDecoder).

Follow this URL:
https://github.com/KELLERAGfuerDruckmesstechnik/KellerAgTheThingsNetworkPayloadDecoder/blob/master/PayloadDecoderFunction.js

Important: ChirpStack required another function signature than "The Things Network". For this reason, function Decoder(bytes, **port**) has to be changed to function Decoder(**port**, bytes).
